data.text: @HealthNS At last count there were 158 patients in hospital with Covid due to outbreaks.  Can NSians expect this number to get better or worse as we move to “living with Covid” and drop masks, loosen isolation and gathering size restrictions and basically pretend there’s no pandemic?
@HealthNS I have a mask like that (bought from @MaritimeTartan )! 😁

@HealthNS A mask and a heart and a message: "Thanks for supporting healthy spaces for all".  Very wise and compassionate messaging but we're on track to lift mask mandates in NS, so clearly not supporting healthy spaces for all.  NS government still talking out of both sides of it's mouth.

@HealthNS Is there a reason why children under 16 still aren’t allowed among the named support people? 

Seems odd, eg, to prevent parent from bringing grandchild to visit inpatient who is grandparent (especially if adult support person is solo with nowhere to get temporary childcare)

It’s important to note that while public health measures are easing in community, they remain in place in hospitals. This includes the requirement for support people/visitors to show proof of vaccination when entering health care facilities.
